basic_operation.p: The illustration below is for left-hand drive vehicles. Some button positions are reversed for right-hand drive vehicles.

paraselectitem.title: Vehicles with navigation/multimedia system
paraselectitem.p: Refer to the “Navigation and Multimedia System Owner’s Manual”.

note_para.title: Using cellular phones
note_para.p:
Interference may be heard through the audio system’s speakers if a cellular phone is being used
inside or close to the vehicle while the audio system is operating.

attention_para.title: To prevent battery discharge
attention_para.p: Do not leave the audio system on longer than necessary with the engine is stopped.

attention_para.title:
To avoid damaging the audio
system
attention_para.p:
Take care not to spill drinks or other fluids over the audio
system.

titlegroupcell.title: Using the steering wheel audio switches

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Some audio features can be controlled using the switches on the steering wheel.
Operation may differ depending on the type of audio system or navigation system. For details, refer to the manual provided with the audio system or navigation system.

titlegroupcell.title: Operating the audio system using the steering wheel switches

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: Press: Increases/decreases volume
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Continuously increases/decreases volume
Press: Turn the power on, select an audio source
Press and hold until you hear a beep:
Radio or AUX mode: Mute
CD, MP3/WMA/AAC disc, iPod, USB or Bluetooth® audio mode: Pause the current operation.
To cancel the mute or pause, press and hold the switch again.
Press: Select a radio station saved in preset channels.
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Seek up/down

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: CD, MP3/WMA/AAC disc, iPod, USB or Bluetooth® audio mode:

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: Press: Select a track/file
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Select a folder or album (MP3/WMA/AAC disc, USB or Bluetooth® audio)
Press: Increases/decreases volume
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Continuously increases/decreases volume
Press: Turn the power on, select an audio source
Press and hold until you hear a beep:
Radio or AUX mode: Mute
CD, MP3/WMA/AAC disc, iPod, USB or Bluetooth® audio mode: Pause the current operation.
To cancel the mute or pause, press and hold the switch again.

note_para.title: Changing the audio source
note_para.p: Press the “MODE” switch when the audio system is turned on. The audio source changes as follows each time the button is pressed. If a mode cannot be used, it will be skipped.
AM→FM→CD or MP3/WMA/AAC→iPod or USB memory→Bluetooth® audio→AUX

attention_para.title: To reduce the risk of an accident
attention_para.p: Exercise care when operating the audio switches on the steering wheel.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Connect an iPod, USB memory device or portable audio player to the AUX port/USB port as indicated below. Press the “MODE” button to select “iPod”, “USB” or “AUX”.

titlegroupcell.title: Connecting using the AUX port/USB port

basic_operation.title: iPod
basic_operation.p: Connect an iPod using an iPod cable.
basic_operation.p_sub: Turn on the power of the iPod if it is not turned on.

basic_operation.title: USB memory
basic_operation.p: Connect the USB memory device.
basic_operation.p_sub: Turn on the power of the USB memory device if it is not turned on.

basic_operation.title: Portable audio player
basic_operation.p: Connect the portable audio player.
basic_operation.p_sub: Turn on the power of the portable audio player if it is not turned on.

note_para.title: AUX port
note_para.p: The AUX port only supports audio input.

attention_para.title: While driving
attention_para.p: Do not connect a device or operate the device controls.

titlegroupcell.title: Optimal use of the audio system

paratablecell.paratabletxt: The sound quality, volume balance and ASL settings can be adjusted and the day mode can be selected.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Displays the “SETUP” menu/Selects the mode

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: “Sound setting”
“RADIO”
“Bluetooth”
“PHONE”

basic_operation.p: When the headlights are turned on, the screen dims.
However, the screen can be switched to day mode by selecting day mode.
The screen will stay in day mode when the headlights are turned on until day mode is selected again.

stepitem.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Turn the knob to select “Sound setting”.
Press the knob.
Turn the knob as corresponds to the desired mode.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: “BASS”, “TREBLE”, “FADER”, “BALANCE”, or “ASL” can be selected.

stepitem.steptxt: Press the knob.

basic_operation.title: Adjusting sound quality
basic_operation.p: Turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob adjusts the level.

footnote.p: The sound quality level is adjusted individually in each audio mode.

basic_operation.p: Press the knob or (BACK) to return to the sound setting menu.

basic_operation.title: Adjusting the Automatic Sound Levelizer (ASL)
basic_operation.p: When ASL is selected, turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to change the amount of ASL.
“LOW”, “MID”, “HIGH” or “OFF” can be selected.
basic_operation.p_sub: ASL automatically adjusts the volume and tone quality according to vehicle speed.
basic_operation.p: Press the knob or (BACK) to return to the sound setting menu.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Press the “MODE” button until “AM” or “FM” is displayed.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

stepitem.steptxt: Search for the desired stations by turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or pressing the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button.
Press and hold one of the station selectors to be set until you hear a beep.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Maintaining perfect radio reception at all times is difficult due to the continually changing position of the antenna, differences in signal strength and surrounding objects, such as trains, transmitters, etc.
The radio antenna is mounted on the roof.

section.title: Playing an audio CD and MP3/WMA discs

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Insert a disc, press the “MODE” button to begin listening to a CD.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

calloutitem.callouttxt: Selecting a track, fast-forwarding or rewinding

titlegroupcell.title: Loading a CD or MP3/WMA/AAC disc

basic_operation.p: Insert a disc.

titlegroupcell.title: Ejecting a CD or MP3/WMA/AAC disc

basic_operation.p: Press the disc eject button and remove the disc.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a track
basic_operation.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down until the desired track number is displayed.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a track from a track list

stepitem.steptxt: Press (LIST).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The track list will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn and press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select a track.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous display, press (BACK).

basic_operation.title: Fast-forwarding and rewinding tracks
basic_operation.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.

basic_operation.title: Random play
basic_operation.p: Press (RDM).

basic_operation.title: Repeat play
basic_operation.p: Press (RPT).

basic_operation.title: Switching the display
basic_operation.p: Press (TEXT) to display or hide the CD title.
basic_operation.p_sub: If there are continuing texts, is displayed.
Press and hold (TEXT) until you hear a beep to display the remaining texts.

basic_operation.title: Selecting folders one at a time
basic_operation.p: Press (<FOLDER) or (FOLDER>) to select the desired folder.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a folder and file from folder list

stepitem.steptxt: Press “TUNE•SELECT” knob or (LIST).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The folder list will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn and press the knob to select a folder and a file.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous display, press (BACK).

basic_operation.title: Returning to the first folder
basic_operation.p: Press and hold (<FOLDER) until you hear a beep.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a file
basic_operation.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down to select the desired file.

basic_operation.title: Fast-forwarding and rewinding files
basic_operation.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.

basic_operation.title: Random play
basic_operation.p: Pressing (RDM) changes modes in the following order: Folder random→Disc random→Off

basic_operation.title: Repeat play
basic_operation.p: Pressing (RPT) changes modes in the following order: File repeat→Folder repeat*→Off

footnote.p: Available except when “RDM” (random play) is selected

basic_operation.title: Switching the display
basic_operation.p: Press (TEXT) to display or hide the album title.
basic_operation.p_sub: If there are continuing texts, is displayed.
Press and hold (TEXT) until you hear a beep to display the remaining texts.

note_para.title: Display
note_para.p: Depending on the contents recorded, the characters may not be displayed properly or may not be displayed at all.

note_para.title: Error messages
note_para.p: If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

entry.p: The disc may be dirty, damaged or inserted upside-down. Clean the disc or insert it correctly.
There is a trouble inside the system.
An over current error has occurred.
Operation has stopped due to a high temperature inside the player. Wait for a while and then press the “MODE” button. If the CD still cannot be played back, contact your Toyota dealer.
This indicates that the MP3, WMA or AAC file is not included in the CD.

note_para.title: Discs that can be used
note_para.p: Discs with the marks shown below can be used.
Playback may not be possible depending on recording format or disc features, or due to scratches, dirt or deterioration.
CDs with copy-protect features may not play correctly.

note_para.title: CD player protection feature
note_para.p: To protect the internal components, playback is automatically stopped when a problem is detected while the CD player is being used.

note_para.title: If a CD is left inside the CD player or in the ejected position for extended periods
note_para.p: The CD may be damaged and may not play properly.

note_para.title: Lens cleaners
note_para.p: Do not use lens cleaners. Doing so may damage the CD player.

note_para.title: MP3, WMA and AAC files
note_para.p: MP3 (MPEG Audio LAYER3) is a standard audio compression format.
Files can be compressed to approximately 1/10 of their original size by using MP3 compression.
WMA (Windows Media Audio) is a Microsoft audio compression format.
This format compresses audio data to a size smaller than that of the MP3 format.
AAC is short for Advanced Audio Coding and refers to an audio compression technology standard used with MPEG2 and MPEG4.
There is a limit to the MP3, WMA and AAC file standards and to the media/formats recorded by them that can be used.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: MP3 file compatibility

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Compatible channel modes: stereo, joint stereo, dual channel and monaural

att_list1_item.itemtxt: WMA file compatibility

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Compatible bit rates (only compatible with 2-channel playback)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: AAC file compatibility
Compatible media
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Media that can be used for MP3, WMA and AAC playback are CD-Rs and CD-RWs.
Playback in some instances may not be possible, depending on the status of the CD-R or CD-RW. Playback may not be possible or the audio may jump if the disc is scratched or marked with fingerprints.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Compatible disc formats
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: The following disc formats can be used.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Disc formats: CD-ROM Mode 1 and Mode 2 CD-ROM XA Mode 2, Form 1 and Form 2
File formats: ISO9660 Level 1, Level 2, (Romeo, Joliet) UDF2.01
att_list2_item.itemtxt_sub: MP3, WMA and AAC files written in any format other than those listed above may not play correctly, and their file names and folder names may not be displayed correctly.

att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Items related to standards and limitations are as follows.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Maximum directory hierarchy: 8 levels (including the root)
Maximum length of folder names/file names: 32 characters
Maximum number of folders: 192 (including the root)
Maximum number of files per disc: 255

att_list1_item.itemtxt: File names
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: The only files that can be recognized as MP3/WMA/AAC and played are those with the extension .mp3, .wma or .m4a.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Multi-sessions
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: As the audio system is compatible with multi-sessions, it is possible to play discs that contain MP3, WMA and AAC files. However, only the first session can be played.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: ID3, WMA and AAC tags
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: ID3 tags can be added to MP3 files, making it possible to record the track title, artist name, etc.
The system is compatible with ID3 Ver. 1.0, 1.1, and Ver. 2.2, 2.3 ID3 tags. (The number of characters is based on ID3 Ver. 1.0 and 1.1.)
WMA tags can be added to WMA files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.
AAC tags can be added to AAC files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: MP3, WMA and AAC playback
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: When a disc containing MP3, WMA or AAC files is inserted, all files on the disc are first checked. Once the file check is finished, the first MP3, WMA or AAC file is played. To make the file check finish more quickly, we recommend you do not write in any files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files or create any unnecessary folders.
If the discs contain a mixture of music data and MP3, WMA or AAC format data, only music data can be played.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Extensions
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: If the file extensions .mp3, .wma and .m4a. are used for files other than MP3, WMA and AAC files, they will be mistakenly recognized and played as MP3, WMA and AAC files. This may result in large amounts of interference and damage to the speakers.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Playback

att_list2_item.itemtxt: To play MP3 file with steady sound quality, we recommend a fixed bit rate of 128 kbps and a sampling frequency of 44.1 kHz.
CD-R or CD-RW playback may not be possible in some instances, depending on the characteristics of the disc.

There is a wide variety of freeware and other encoding software for MP3, WMA and AAC files on the market, and depending on the status of the encoding and the file format, poor sound quality or noise at the start of playback may result. In some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
When files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files are recorded on a disc, it may take more time to recognize the disc and in some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
Microsoft, Windows, and Windows Media are the registered trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the U.S.A. and other countries.

attention_para.title: Discs and adapters that cannot be used
attention_para.p: Do not use the following types of discs.
Also, do not use 8 cm (3 in.) disc adapters, DualDiscs or printable discs.
Doing so may damage the player and/or the disc insert/eject function.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Discs that have a diameter that is not 12 cm (4.7 in.)
Low-quality and deformed discs
Discs with a transparent or translucent recording area
Discs that have tape, stickers or CD-R labels attached to them, or that have had the label peeled off

attention_para.title: Player precautions
attention_para.p: Failure to follow the precautions below may result in serious damage to the discs or the player itself.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not insert anything other than discs into the disc slot.
Do not apply oil to the player.
Store discs away from direct sunlight.
Never try to disassemble any part of the player.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Connecting an iPod enables you to enjoy music from the vehicle speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “iPod” is displayed.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off
Press: Displaying list of the current folder

calloutitem.callouttxt: Selecting a song, fast-forwarding or rewinding

stepitem.steptxt: Press (BROWSE) to select iPod play mode.
Turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob clockwise changes the play mode in the following order: “Playlists”→“Artists”→“Albums”→“Songs”→“Genres”→“Composers”→“Radio”→“Audiobooks”→“Podcasts”→“iTunes U”
Press the knob to select the desired play mode.
Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to display the first selection list.
Press the knob to select the desired item and display the second selection list.
Repeat the same procedure to select the desired item.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous selection list, press (BACK).
Press (PLAY) to play the desired selection.

basic_operation.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to select the desired song.

titlegroupcell.title: Selecting a song from the song list

stepitem.steptxt: Press (LIST).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The song list will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select a song.
Press the knob to play the song.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous display, press (BACK).

basic_operation.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.
Pressing (RPT) changes modes in the following order: Track repeat→Album repeat*→Off

footnote.p: Album repeat mode may not be available depending on the iPod devices you have.

basic_operation.p: Pressing (RDM) changes modes in the following order: Track random→Album random→Off
Press the (TEXT) to display or hide the album title.
basic_operation.p_sub: If there are continuing texts, is displayed.
Press and hold (TEXT) until you hear a beep to display the remaining texts.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Use of the Made for Apple badge means that an accessory has been designed to connect specifically to the Apple product(s) identified in the badge, and has been certified by the developer to meet Apple performance standards. Apple is not responsible for the operation of this device or its compliance with safety and regulatory standards. Please note that the use of this accessory with an Apple product may affect wireless performance.
iTunes U, iPod, iPod touch, iPod nano and iPhone are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
When an iPod is connected and the audio source is changed to iPod mode, the iPod will resume play from the same point in which it was last used.
Depending on the iPod that is connected to the system, certain functions may not be available. Disconnecting the device and reconnecting it once again may resolve some malfunctions.
While connected to the system, the iPod cannot be operated with its own controls. It is necessary to use the controls of the vehicle’s audio system instead.

note_para.title: iPod problems
note_para.p: To resolve most problems encountered when using your iPod, disconnect your iPod from the vehicle iPod connection and reset it.
For instructions on how to reset your iPod, refer to your iPod Owner’s Manual.

note_para.title: Error messages
note_para.p: If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

entry.p: This indicates that the data in the iPod cannot be read.
This indicates that the iPod may be malfunctioning.
This indicates that an over current error has occurred.
This indicates that an iPod communication error has occurred.
This indicates that an authentication error has occurred.
This indicates that there is no music data in the iPod.
This indicates that some available songs are not found in a selected playlist.
This indicates that the version of the iPod is not compatible. Upgrade your iPod software to the latest version.

note_para.title: Compatible models
note_para.p: The following devices can be used with this system.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Made for

note_para.p: This system only supports audio playback.
Depending on differences between models or software versions etc., some models might be incompatible with this system.

attention_para.title: While driving
attention_para.p: Do not connect iPod or operate the controls. Doing so may cause an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not leave iPod in the vehicle. The temperature inside the vehicle may become high, resulting in damage to the iPod.
Do not push down on or apply unnecessary pressure to the iPod while it is connected as this may damage the iPod or its terminal.
Do not insert foreign objects into the port as this may damage the iPod or its terminal.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Connecting a USB memory enables you to enjoy music from the vehicle speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “USB” is displayed.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

calloutitem.callouttxt: Selecting a file, fast-forwarding or rewinding

basic_operation.title: Selecting folders one at a time
basic_operation.p: Press (<FOLDER) or (FOLDER>) to select the desired folder.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a folder and file from folder list

stepitem.steptxt: Press (LIST).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The folder list will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn and press the knob to select a folder and file.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous display, press (BACK).

basic_operation.title: Returning to the first folder
basic_operation.p: Press and hold (<FOLDER) until you hear a beep.

basic_operation.title: Selecting a file
basic_operation.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down to select the desired file.

basic_operation.title: Fast-forwarding and rewinding files
basic_operation.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.

basic_operation.title: Random play
basic_operation.p: Pressing (RDM) changes modes in the following order: Folder random→All folder random→Off

basic_operation.title: Repeat play
basic_operation.p: Pressing (RPT) changes modes in the following order: File repeat→Folder repeat*→Off

footnote.p: Available except when “RDM” (random play) is selected

basic_operation.title: Switching the display
basic_operation.p: Press (TEXT) to display or hide the album title.
basic_operation.p_sub: If there are continuing texts, is displayed.
Press and hold (TEXT) until you hear a beep to display the remaining texts.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Depending on the USB memory that is connected to the system, the device itself may not be operable and certain functions may not be available. If the device is inoperable or a function is unavailable due to a malfunction (as opposed to a system specification), disconnecting the device and reconnecting it once again may resolve the problem.
If the USB memory still does not begin operation after being disconnected and reconnected, format the memory.

note_para.title: Error messages
note_para.p: If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

entry.p: This indicates that the data in the USB memory cannot be read.
This indicates that the USB memory may be malfunctioning.
This indicates that an over current error has occurred.
This indicates that the USB memory communication error has occurred.
This indicates that no MP3/WMA/AAC files are included on the USB memory device.
This indicates that the hub connect error occurs.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Compatible devices
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: USB memory that can be used for MP3, WMA and AAC playback

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Compatible device formats
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: The following device formats can be used:
MP3, WMA and AAC files written in any format other than those listed above may not play correctly, and their file names and folder names may not be displayed correctly.
Items related to standards and limitations are as follows:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Maximum directory hierarchy: 8 levels (including the root)
Maximum number of folders in a device: 3000
Maximum number of files in a device: 9999
Maximum number of files per folder: 255

att_list1_item.itemtxt: MP3, WMA and AAC files
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: MP3 (MPEG Audio LAYER3) is a standard audio compression format.
Files can be compressed to approximately 1/10 of their original size by using MP3 compression.
WMA (Windows Media Audio) is a Microsoft audio compression format.
This format compresses audio data to a size smaller than that of the MP3 format.
AAC is short for Advanced Audio Coding and refers to an audio compression technology standard used with MPEG2 and MPEG4.
There is a limit to the MP3, WMA and AAC file standards and to the media/formats recorded by them that can be used.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: MP3 file compatibility

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Compatible channel modes: stereo, joint stereo, dual channel and monaural

att_list1_item.itemtxt: WMA file compatibility

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Compatible bit rates (only compatible with 2-channel playback)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: AAC file compatibility
File names
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: The only files that can be recognized as MP3/WMA/AAC and played are those with the extension .mp3, .wma or .m4a.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: ID3, WMA and AAC tags
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: ID3 tags can be added to MP3 files, making it possible to record the track title, artist name, etc.
The system is compatible with ID3 Ver. 1.0, 1.1, and Ver. 2.2, 2.3, 2.4 ID3 tags. (The number of characters is based on ID3 Ver. 1.0 and 1.1.)
WMA tags can be added to WMA files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.
AAC tags can be added to AAC files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: MP3, WMA and AAC playback

att_list2_item.itemtxt: When a device containing MP3, WMA or AAC files is connected, all files in the USB memory device are checked. Once the file check is finished, the first MP3, WMA or AAC file is played. To make the file check finish more quickly, we recommend that you do not include any files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files or create any unnecessary folders.

When the USB device is connected and the audio source is changed to USB memory mode, the USB device will start playing the first file in the first folder. If the same device is removed and reinserted (and the contents have not been changed), the USB memory will resume play from the same point in which it was last used.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Extensions
att_list1_item.itemtxt_sub: If the file extensions .mp3, .wma and .m4a. are used for files other than MP3, WMA and AAC files, they will be skipped (not played).

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Playback

att_list2_item.itemtxt: To play MP3 files with steady sound quality, we recommend a fixed bit rate of at least 128 kbps and a sampling frequency of 44.1 kHz.

There is a wide variety of freeware and other encoding software for MP3, WMA and AAC files on the market, and depending on the status of the encoding and the file format, poor sound quality or noise at the start of playback may result. In some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
Microsoft, Windows, and Windows Media are registered trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the U.S.A. and other countries.

attention_para.title: While driving
attention_para.p: Do not connect USB memory or operate the controls. Doing so may cause an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage to USB memory

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not leave USB memory in the vehicle. The temperature inside the vehicle may become high, resulting in damage to the USB memory.
Do not push down on or apply unnecessary pressure to the USB memory while it is connected as this may damage the USB memory or its terminal.
Do not insert foreign objects into the port as this may damage the USB memory or its terminal.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: This port can be used to connect a portable audio device and listen to it using the vehicle’s speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “AUX” is displayed.

note_para.title: Operating portable audio devices connected to the audio system
note_para.p: The volume can be adjusted using the vehicle audio controls. All other adjustments must be made on the portable audio device itself.

note_para.title: When using a portable audio device connected to the power outlet
note_para.p: Noise may occur during playback. Use the power source of the portable audio device.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: The following can be performed using Bluetooth® wireless communication:

basic_operation.p: The Bluetooth® audio system enables you to enjoy music played on a portable digital audio player (portable player) from the vehicle speakers via wireless communication.

This audio system supports Bluetooth®, a wireless data system capable of playing portable audio music without cables. If your portable player does not support Bluetooth®, the Bluetooth® audio system will not function.
This system supports Bluetooth®, which allows you to make or receive calls without using cables to connect a cellular phone and the system, and without operating the cellular phone.

stepitem.steptxt: Register the Bluetooth® device to be used with audio system (→)
Select the Bluetooth® device to be used (→, )
Set automatic connection of the device (→)
Check Bluetooth® connection condition (→)

list1_item.itemtxt: To be used for hands-free phone: →

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Turns the hands-free system on/starts a call
Turns the hands-free system off/ends a call/refuses a call
Press: Turning the audio system on or off
Displays setup menu or selects items such as menu and number
If “BT” is not displayed, the Bluetooth® audio/phone cannot be used.
A message, name, number, etc. is displayed.

titlegroupcell.title: Menu list of the Bluetooth® audio/phone

basic_operation.p: To enter a menu, press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and navigate menus by using the knob.

entry.p: Setting automatic connection of the device on or off (→)
Setting the automatic connection confirmation display to on or off (→)
Setting automatic contact/history transfer on or off (→)
Deleting a contact stored in the phonebook (→)
Sorting contacts by the first name or last name field (→)
Deleting a number stored in the call history (→)
Adding a new contact to the favorite list (→)
Deleting a contact from the favorite list (→)

footnote.p: For PBAP compatible Bluetooth® phones, this function is available when “Auto transfer ON” is set to off.

note_para.title: Bluetooth® audio/phone system functions
note_para.p: Depending on the Bluetooth® device, certain functions may not be available.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: The steering wheel switches can be used to operate a connected cellular phone, or portable digital audio player (portable player).

titlegroupcell.title: Operating Bluetooth® phone using the steering wheel switches

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: If the switch is pressed during a call, the call will end.
If the switch is pressed when an incoming call is received, the call will be answered.
If the switch is pressed when a call waiting call is received, the waiting call will be answered.
Press the “+” side to increase the volume.
Press the “-” side to decrease the volume.
If the switch is pressed during a call, the call will end.
If the switch is pressed when an incoming call is received, the call will be answered.
If the switch is pressed when a call waiting call is received, the waiting call will be answered.
Press the “+” side to increase the volume.
Press the “-” side to decrease the volume.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Before using the Bluetooth® audio/phone, it is necessary to register a Bluetooth® device in the system. You can register up to 5 Bluetooth® devices.

titlegroupcell.title: How to register a Bluetooth® device

stepitem.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and select “Bluetooth” using the knob.
Press the knob and select “Pairing” using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: A passkey will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: SSP (Secure Simple Pairing) incompatible Bluetooth® devices: Input the passkey into the device.
SSP (Secure Simple Pairing) compatible Bluetooth® devices: Select “Yes” to register the device. Depending on the type of device, it may register automatically.

basic_operation.p: If a Bluetooth® device has both music player and cellular phone functions, both functions will be registered at the same time. When deleting the device, both functions will be deleted at the same time.
If the off-hook button is pressed and the “PHONE” mode is entered when no phones have been registered, the registration screen will be automatically displayed.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Registering a Bluetooth® device in the system allows the system to function. The following functions can be used for registered devices. To enter the setup menu, press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and select “Bluetooth” using the knob.

basic_operation.p: Select “Pairing” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob, and perform the procedure for registering a device. (→)
Select “List phone” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob. The list of registered cellular phones will be displayed.

paraselectitem.title: Connecting the registered cellular phone to the audio system

stepitem.steptxt: Select the name of the cellular phone to be connected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Select” using the knob.
Select the name of the cellular phone to be deleted using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete” using the knob.
Press (YES).

paraselectitem.title: Disconnecting the registered cellular phone from the audio system

stepitem.steptxt: Select the name of the cellular phone to be disconnected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Disconnect” using the knob.
Press (YES).

basic_operation.p: Select “List audio” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob. The list of registered portable players will be displayed.

paraselectitem.title: Connecting the registered portable player to the audio system

stepitem.steptxt: Select the name of the portable player to be connected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Select” using the knob.
Select the name of the portable player to be deleted using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete” using the knob.
Press (YES).

paraselectitem.title: Disconnecting the registered portable player from the audio system

stepitem.steptxt: Select the name of the portable player to be disconnected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Disconnect” using the knob.
Press (YES).
Select the name of the desired portable player using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Connection method” using the knob.
Select “From vehicle” or “From audio” using the knob.
Select “Passkey” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a 4 to 8-digit passkey using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Input the number 1 digit at a time.

stepitem.steptxt: When the entire number to be registered as a passkey has been input, press (ENTER).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: If the passkey to be registered has 8 digits, pressing (ENTER) is not necessary.

titlegroupcell.title: Setting automatic connection of the device on or off

basic_operation.p: If “BT power OFF” is set to on, the registered device will be connected automatically when the engine switch is turned to ACC or OFF.
Select “BT power ON” or “BT power OFF” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Bluetooth info” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.

titlegroupcell.title: Setting the automatic connection confirmation display to on or off

basic_operation.p: If the “Display setting” is set to on, the portable player connection status will be displayed when the engine switch is turned to ACC or OFF.
Select “Display setting ON” or “Display setting OFF” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Initialize” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.

paraselectitem.title: Initializing the “Sound setting”
paraselectitem.p: Select “Sound setting” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and press (YES).

paraselectitem.title: Initializing the device information
paraselectitem.p: Select “Car device info” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and press (YES).
Automatic connection of a portable device, automatic connection confirmation display and the passkey will be initialized.

paraselectitem.title: Initializing the all settings
paraselectitem.p: Select “All initialize” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and press (YES).

paratablecell.paratabletxt: To enter the setup menu, press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and select “PHONE” using the knob.

basic_operation.p: The automatic transfer function is available for PBAP compatible Bluetooth® phones only.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Auto transfer ON” or “Auto transfer OFF” using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: When set to on, the phone’s contact data and history are automatically transferred.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Add contacts” using the knob.

paraselectitem.title: Transferring all contacts from the cellular phone

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Overwrite all” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and press (YES).

paraselectitem.title: Transferring one contact from the cellular phone

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Add one contact” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and press (YES).
Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete contacts” using the knob.
Select the desired phone number using the knob and press (YES).

basic_operation.p: To delete all the registered phone numbers, press (ALL) and then press (YES).
Press (A-Z) to display the registered names in alphabetical order of the initial.

titlegroupcell.title: Changing the sorting order of the contacts

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Sort contacts” using the knob.
Select “Sort by first” or “Sort by last” using the knob.

basic_operation.p: This function is available for PBAP compatible Bluetooth® phones only.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Transfer history” using the knob and press (YES).
Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete call history” using the knob.
Select “Outgoing calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired phone number using the knob and press (YES).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To delete all outgoing call history data, press (ALL) and then press (YES).

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Incoming calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired phone number using the knob and press (YES).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To delete all incoming call history data, press (ALL) and then press (YES).

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Missed calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired phone number using the knob and press (YES).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To delete all missed call history data, press (ALL) and then press (YES).

paraselectitem.title: Deleting a number from all call histories (Outgoing calls, Incoming calls and Missed calls)

stepitem.steptxt: Select “All calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired phone number using the knob and press (YES).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To delete all of the call histories data, press (ALL) and then press (YES).

basic_operation.p: Up to 15 contacts can be registered in the favorites list.

basic_operation.title: Registering the contacts from the “SETUP” mode

stepitem.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “PHONE” using the knob.
Select “Favorites” using the knob.
Select “Add favorites” using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Press (A-Z) to display the registered names in alphabetical order of the initial.

stepitem.steptxt: Select desired contact using the knob.

basic_operation.title: Registering the contacts from the “PHONE” mode

stepitem.steptxt: Press the off-hook button.
Select “Phonebook”, “All calls”, “Missed calls”, “Incoming calls” or “Outgoing calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a desired number using the knob.
Press (Add favorites).

list1_item.itemtxt: When 15 contacts have already been registered to the favorites list, a registered contact needs to be replaced.

stepitem.steptxt: Select the contact to be replaced using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select (YES) when the confirmation screen appears.

basic_operation.title: Deleting the contacts from the “SETUP” mode

stepitem.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “PHONE” using the knob.
Select “Favorites” using the knob.
Select “Delete favorites” using the knob.
Select desired contact using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: You can select all contacts by selecting (ALL).

stepitem.steptxt: Select (YES) when the confirmation screen appears.

basic_operation.title: Deleting the contacts from the “PHONE” mode

stepitem.steptxt: Press the off-hook button.
Select “Favorites” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a desired number using the knob.
Press (Delete favorites).
Select desired contact using the knob.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Press (ALL) to delete all favorites.

stepitem.steptxt: Select (YES) when the confirmation screen appears.
Select “HF sound setting” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Call volume” using the knob.
Change the call volume.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To decrease the volume: Turn the knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the knob clockwise.
To set the volume, press (BACK).

stepitem.steptxt: Select “HF sound setting” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Ringtone volume” using the knob.
Change the ring tone volume.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To decrease the volume: Turn the knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the knob clockwise.
To set the volume, press (BACK).

stepitem.steptxt: Select “HF sound setting” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Ringtone” using the knob.
Using the knob, select a ring tone (1 - 3 or “From phone”). To set the selected ring tone, press (BACK).

note_para.title: Phone number
note_para.p: Up to 5000 names (maximum of 1000 names per device) can be stored.

note_para.title: Call history
note_para.p: Up to 10 numbers can be stored in each of the outgoing, incoming and missed call history memories.

note_para.title: Limitation of number of digits
note_para.p: A phone number that exceeds 24 digits cannot be registered.

note_para.title: Bluetooth® phone system functions
note_para.p: Certain functions may not be available during driving.

titlegroupcell.title: Operating a Bluetooth® enabled portable player

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off
Press: Displaying list of the current folder

calloutitem.callouttxt: Selecting a track, fast-forwarding or rewinding

basic_operation.p: Press (<FOLDER) or (FOLDER>) to select desired album.
Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down.
Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.
Pressing (RPT) changes modes in the following order: Track repeat→Album repeat*→Off

footnote.p: Available except when “RDM” (random play) is selected

basic_operation.p: Pressing (RDM) changes modes in the following order: Album random→All album random→Off

stepitem.steptxt: Press (BROWSE).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The playlist will be displayed.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to display the folder/file list.
Press the knob to select the desired item.
Repeat the same procedure to select the desired file.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To return to the previous display, press (BACK).

basic_operation.p: Press (TEXT) to display or hide the album title.
basic_operation.p_sub: If there are continuing texts, is displayed.
Press and hold (TEXT) until you hear a beep to display the remaining texts.

note_para.title: Bluetooth® audio system functions
note_para.p: Depending on the portable player that is connected to the system, certain functions may not be available.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: To enter the “PHONE” mode, press the off-hook button.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Phonebook” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired name using the knob and press the off-hook button.

basic_operation.p: Press (A-Z) to display the registered names in alphabetical order of the initial.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Favorites” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select the desired name using the knob and press the off-hook button.
Select “Dial by number” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Enter the phone number and press the off-hook switch.
Select “All calls”, “Missed calls”, “Incoming calls” or “Outgoing calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a desired number using the knob and press the off-hook button.

basic_operation.p: The following operations can be performed:

list1_item.itemtxt: Registering a number as a Favorite

basic_operation.p: Press the off-hook button.
Press the on-hook button.

titlegroupcell.title: Receiving a call when on another call

basic_operation.p: Press the off-hook button.
basic_operation.p_sub: Pressing the off-hook button again returns you to the previous call.

note_para.p: This function may not be available depending on the type of cellular phone.

titlegroupcell.title: Adjusting the ring tone volume when receiving a call

basic_operation.p: To decrease the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob clockwise.
A call can be transferred between the cellular phone and system while dialing, receiving a call, or during a call. Use one of the following methods:
a. Operate the cellular phone.
basic_operation.p_sub: Refer to the manual that comes with the cellular phone for the operation of the phone.
basic_operation.p: b. Press (PHONE).*

footnote.p: This operation can be performed only when transferring a call from the cellular phone to the system during a call.

basic_operation.p: Press (MUTE).
Press (UNMUTE) to cancel the mute.
This operation cannot be performed while driving.

stepitem.steptxt: Press (0-9)
Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select the desired number.
Press the knob to decide the number.
Press (SEND) to send tones.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Pressing (BACK) preserves the number and returns to the previous screen.
Pressing (EXIT) deletes the number and go to “Enter a number” screen.

paraselectitem.title: Phone number containing a “p” symbol
paraselectitem.p: When the “p” symbol is dialed in an outgoing call, there will be a pause for 2 seconds before the following digits are dialed automatically.

paraselectitem.title: Phone number containing a “w” symbol
paraselectitem.p: When the “w” symbol is dialed in an outgoing call, you need to press (SEND) again to dial following digits.
This operation can be performed while driving.

basic_operation.p: Your voice volume that the other party hears from their speaker can be adjusted.

stepitem.steptxt: Press (Send vol)
Use the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to adjust the volume. (-5 to +5)

basic_operation.p: To decrease the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob clockwise.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not talk simultaneously with the other party.
Keep the volume of the received voice down. Otherwise, voice echo will increase.

note_para.title: Automatic volume adjustment
note_para.p: When vehicle speed is 80 km/h (50 mph) or more, the volume automatically increases. The volume returns to the previous volume setting when vehicle speed drops to 70 km/h (43 mph) or less.

note_para.title: Phone call system functions
note_para.p: Depending on the cellular phone, certain functions may not be available.

note_para.title: Situations where the system may not recognize your voice

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When driving on a rough road
When driving at high speeds
When air is blowing out of the vents onto the microphone
When the air conditioning fans emits a loud noise

list1_item.itemtxt: In the following situations, the system may not function.

list2_item.itemtxt: The portable player does not support Bluetooth®
The cellular phone is located outside the service area
The Bluetooth® device is switched off
The Bluetooth® device has a low battery
The Bluetooth® device is not connected to the system
The Bluetooth® device is behind the seat or in the glove box or console box, or metal material covers or touches the device

list1_item.itemtxt: There may be a delay if a cellular phone connection is made during Bluetooth® audio play.
Depending on the type of portable audio player that is connected to the system, operation may differ slightly and certain functions may not be available.
This system is not guaranteed to operate with all Bluetooth® devices.

basic_operation.title: When transferring ownership of the vehicle
basic_operation.p: Be sure to initialize the system to prevent personal data from being improperly accessed. (→)

basic_operation.title: About Bluetooth®
basic_operation.p: Bluetooth is a registered trademark of Bluetooth SIG, Inc.

basic_operation.title: Compatible models
basic_operation.p: The Bluetooth® audio system supports portable audio players with the following specifications

list1_item.itemtxt: Bluetooth® specifications: Ver. 1.1 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 4.1+EDR or higher)

list2_item.itemtxt: A2DP (Advanced Audio Distribution Profile) Ver. 1.0, or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.3)
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to transmit stereo audio or high quality sound to the audio system.

list2_item.itemtxt: AVRCP (Audio/Video Remote Control Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.6)
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to allow remote control the A/V equipment.

basic_operation.p: However, please note that some functions may be limited depending on the type of portable audio player connected.
The hands-free system supports cellular phones with the following specifications.

list2_item.itemtxt: HFP (Hands Free Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.7)
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to allow hands-free phone calls using a cellular phone or head set. It has outgoing and incoming call functions.

list2_item.itemtxt: OPP (Object Push Profile) Ver. 1.1 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.2)
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to transfer phonebook data. When a Bluetooth® compatible cellular phone has both PBAP and OPP, OPP cannot be used.

list2_item.itemtxt: PBAP (Phone Book Access Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.2)
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to transfer phonebook data.

attention_para.title: While driving
attention_para.p: Do not operate the portable audio player, cellular phone or connect a device to the Bluetooth® system.

attention_para.title: Caution regarding interference with electronic devices

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Your audio unit is fitted with Bluetooth® antennas. People with implantable cardiac pacemakers, cardiac resynchronization therapy-pacemakers or implantable cardioverter defibrillators should maintain a reasonable distance between themselves and the Bluetooth® antennas. The radio waves may affect the operation of such devices.

Before using Bluetooth® devices, users of any electrical medical device other than implantable cardiac pacemakers, cardiac resynchronization therapy-pacemakers or implantable cardioverter defibrillators should consult the manufacturer of the device for information about its operation under the influence of radio waves. Radio waves could have unexpected effects on the operation of such medical devices.

attention_para.title: When leaving the vehicle
attention_para.p: Do not leave your portable audio player or cellular phone in the vehicle. The inside of the vehicle may become hot, causing damage to the portable audio player or cellular phone.
